Gameplay

Class Mob

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
      • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
        • java.awt.Rectangle
          • Gameplay.Mob
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Mob
extends java.awt.Rectangle
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int direction
      direction - int variable storing the default direction of that the mob travels in, which is travelling right, into the screen.
      int DOWNWARD
      DOWNWARD - final int that keeps track of the downward direction that a mob can move towards and into.
      boolean hasDownward
      hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved downwards.
      boolean hasLeft
      hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved left.
      boolean hasRight
      hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved right.
      boolean hasUpward
      hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved upwards.
      int health
      health - int variable storing the mob's health points.
      int healthGap
      health - int variable storing the mob's health gap, used for visual and aesthetic purposes.
      boolean inGame
      inGame - boolean variable preset to false to check if a mob has spawned in the game screen or not.
      int LEFT
      LEFT - final int that keeps track of the left direction that a mob can move towards and into.
      int maxHealth
      maxHealth - int storing the max percentile health of a mob.
      int mobID
      mobID - int variable storing the mob's ID to distinguish which mob is being referred to.
      int mobSize
      mobSize - int variable of the mob's size (length+width).
      static int mobSpeed
      moveFrame - static int variable of the mob's speed.
      int mobWalk
      mobWalk - int variable storing how long the mob has walked.
      int moveFrame
      moveFrame - int variable acting as a delay for the mob so the mob has a frame and a speed.
      (package private) int pathValue
      pathValue - int storing the path value such as if it is able for the mob to walk on or not, eg muscle cells cannot be walked on by mobs but blood vessel tiles can!
      (package private) int position
      position - int storing the position of the mob.
      int RIGHT
      RIGHT - final int that keeps track of the right direction that a mob can move towards and into.
      int UPWARD
      UPWARD - final int that keeps track of the upward direction that a mob can move towards and into.
      int xCoord
      xCoord - int variable tracking down the x coordinate location of the mob.
      int yCoord
      yCoord - int variable tracking down the y coordinate location of the mob.

        mobID - int variable storing the mob's ID to distinguish which mob is being referred to.

        inGame - boolean variable preset to false to check if a mob has spawned in the game screen or not.

        mobWalk - int variable storing how long the mob has walked.

      • maxHealth

        public int maxHealth
        maxHealth - int storing the max percentile health of a mob.

      • hasUpward

        public boolean hasUpward
        hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved upwards. It basically tracks where its previous block was so it doesnt move back and forth going nowhere.

      • hasDownward

        public boolean hasDownward
        hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved downwards. It basically tracks where its previous block was so it doesnt move back and forth going nowhere.

      • hasRight

        public boolean hasRight
        hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved right. It basically tracks where its previous block was so it doesnt move back and forth going nowhere.

      • hasLeft

        public boolean hasLeft
        hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved left. It basically tracks where its previous block was so it doesnt move back and forth going nowhere.

      • direction

        public int direction
        direction - int variable storing the default direction of that the mob travels in, which is travelling right, into the screen.

      • xCoord

        public int xCoord
        xCoord - int variable tracking down the x coordinate location of the mob.

      • yCoord

        public int yCoord
        yCoord - int variable tracking down the y coordinate location of the mob.

      • health

        public int health
        health - int variable storing the mob's health points.

      • healthGap

        public int healthGap
        health - int variable storing the mob's health gap, used for visual and aesthetic purposes.

      • moveFrame

        public int moveFrame
        moveFrame - int variable acting as a delay for the mob so the mob has a frame and a speed.

      • mobSpeed

        public static int mobSpeed
        moveFrame - static int variable of the mob's speed.

      • position

        int position
        position - int storing the position of the mob.

      • pathValue

        int pathValue
        pathValue - int storing the path value such as if it is able for the mob to walk on or not, eg muscle cells cannot be walked on by mobs but blood vessel tiles can!

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mob

        public Mob(int path,
           int mobid)
        Constructor for the mob class taking in the path and mobID parameters. This distinguishes what kind of mob will be travelling though in this level and the path they will be taking. Mobs will have different healths according to what type the mob is and the difficulty the user selected.
        Parameters:
        path - int for the upper or lower path the mob will take.
        mobID - int for the type of mob spawning in this level.

    • Method Detail

      • initMob

        public void initMob()
        This method initializes the mob to move, and how long it takes for a mob to first appear on the game play screen.
        Parameters:
        y - int for loop counter

      • deleteMob

        public void deleteMob()
        This method deletes the mob and resets the default direction for the next mob spawning, to move in. Such as when mobs are quarantined by towers or just gone to the finish line and taken away one of the player's health.

      • loseHealth

        public void loseHealth()
        This method allows the YOU to lose health points from the mobs reaching the finish line!

      • process

        public void process()
        This method is responsible for the mob's movement mechanics. It makes sure it walks continuously to the finish line and not back and forth, as it actually knows how to determine a path of travel!

      • loseHealth

        public void loseHealth(int amount)
        This method subtracts from the mob's health every consecutive millisecond it is zapped or striken by a surrounding tower. This method also invokes the checkDeath method to see if the mob has died or not, so it can disappear.
        Parameters:
        amount - int variable of the health the mob will lose.

      • checkDeath

        public void checkDeath()
        This method checks if the mob ran out of health, and if so, the bone marrow currency and score has been increased.

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        This method returns if a mob is dead or not by checking if it is still in the game or not.

      • getMoney

        public void getMoney(int mobID)
        This method is responsible for adding on to the players bank of bone marrow when a mob is quarantined.
        Parameters:
        mobID - int storing which mob it is that was killed and required the money information from.

      • getScore

        public void getScore(int mobID)
        This method is responsible for adding on to the player's score when a mob is quarantined.
        Parameters:
        mobID - int storing which mob it is that was killed and required the score it gives out.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method draws the health bar above the mob.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics reference variable.
